HediffDef.label: dormant lycanthropy
HediffDef.description: The result of leaving Sanies Lupinus untreated. The pawn will violently transform when the next Huntsman's Moon rises, completely succumbing to their beastial side in the process. Once they are fatigued enough, the transformation will come to an end, and they will gain full control over their lycanthropy.

HediffDef.label: immenent transformation
HediffDef.description: A lycanthrope about to experience their first transformation.

HediffDef.label: lycanthrope
HediffDef.description:
A fully fledged lycanthrope, now able to transform into their beast form at will. While the Huntsman's blood offers little benefit outside of beast form, it does provide immunity to certain infections.

<color=#E5E54C>Totems of the Hunt</color>
Lycanthropes are able to use Hunstman's Totems to permanently empower their beast form.

<color=#E5E54C>The Beast Hunt</color>
Lycanthropes are able to complete hunts issued by The Huntsman. Every completed hunt will reward a permanent stacking mood bonus. The lycanthrope must consume the heart of the target in order to complete or progress the hunt.

<color=#E5E54C>Silver Weakness</color>
Takes additional damage from weapons made out of silver, in the form of a burn.

<color=#E5E54C>Restless Sleep</color>
Those with lycanthropy always struggle to get a good nights sleep. They gain no mood bonuses for sleeping in impressive bedrooms or barracks, and instead will always gain a mood debuff after sleep.
HediffDef.descriptionShort: A fully fledged lycanthrope, now able to transform into their beast form at will. While the Huntsman's blood offers little benefit outside of beast form, it does provide immunity to certain infections.

HediffDef.Name: Mashed_Bloodmoon_LycanthropeTransformedBase
HediffDef.label: lycanthrope beast form preview
HediffDef.description: A purely cosmetic transformation used for previews.

HediffDef.label: lycanthrope beast form
HediffDef.description:
A lycanthrope transformed into their beastial form, greatly empowering them, though at a cost. Transformed lycanthropes are unable to do any form of work, and their vocal cords have become too malformed for speech.

<color=#E5E54C>Consume Heart</color>
Transformed Lycanthropes are able to consume the hearts of fresh corpses, and downed pawns, permanentely increasing their lycanthropic stress limit in the process.

<color=#E5E54C>Supressed Inhibitions</color>
Transformed Lycanthropes can eat corpses and raw food without any negative effects.

<color=#E5E54C>Lycanthropic Stress</color>
Lycanthropic stress will gradually build up while in their beastial form. If this ever reaches its limit, the lycanthrope will enter an uncontrollable fury.

<color=#E5E54C>Lycanthropic Fatigue</color>
When a lycanthropes transformation ends, any accumulated stress will be converted into fatigue. Lycanthropes are unable to transform in this state.

<color=#E5E54C>Wolfsbane Weakness</color>
Consuming wolfsbane through any means will cause a great deal of toxic buildup to a transformed lycanthrope. Standing in wolfsbane gas will also cause constant toxic buildup.
HediffDef.descriptionShort: A lycanthrope transformed into their beastial form, greatly empowering them, though at a cost. Transformed lycanthropes are unable to do any form of work, and their vocal cords have become too malformed for speech. Contact with wolfsbane will also cause toxic buildup.

HediffDef.label: lycanthrope fatigue
HediffDef.description: The result of stress accumulated while a lycanthrope is transformed into their beastial form. They will be unable to transform until their body has recovered.

HediffDef.label: lycanthrope claws
HediffDef.description: The rending claws of a transformed lycanthrope. Attacks from these may infect victims with Sanies Lupinus.

HediffDef.label: lycanthrope teeth
HediffDef.description: The snarling maw of a transformed lycanthrope. Attacks from these may infect victims with Sanies Lupinus.
